brief_title: Study of Karenitecin (BNP1350) to Treat Malignant Melanoma
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Karenitecin (BNP1350) as a treatment for Malignant Melanoma.
description: Karenitecn (1.0 mg/m2) administered as a single daily 60-minute intravenous infusion for 5 consecutive days repeated every 21 days (1 treatment cycle). Patients who respond (CR< PR, SD) can continue treatment for 6 cycles, unless unacceptable toxicity develops. Treatment will be discontinued if progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity develops.
criteria: - Confirmed diagnosis of malignant melanoma - Measurable disease - Granulocytes ≥1,500/µl, Platelets ≥100,000/µl, Creatinine ≤ULN, Bilirubin ≤1.5 mg/dl, AST ≤2.5 x ULN - No prior treatment with other camptothecin drug. - ≥ 21 days since completion of prior chemotherapy, ≥6 weeks since prior Mitomycin-C - ECOG Performance Status 0-1 - Negative pregnancy test for female patients
